alert.note: Alert for Northwest Carter; Southeast Carter; Sullivan; Unicoi; Washington (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 4:47PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL SULLIVAN... WASHINGTON...NORTHERN UNICOI AND SOUTHWESTERN CARTER COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 547 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Jonesborough, or 9 miles northwest of Erwin, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Johnson City, Elizabethton, Erwin, Jonesborough, Gray, Banner Hill, Oak Grove, Central, Hampton, and Midway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Carter; Southeast Carter; Sullivan; Unicoi; Washington
